itemDescription: Bishop of Peterborough; Bishop of Edmonton; British Anglican bishop (1925-1999)

wikipedia_page.main: William John Westwood (28 December 1925 – 15 September 1999) was the 36th Anglican Bishop of Peterborough.

response: The son of Bill Westwood, former Anglican Bishop of Peterborough, Westwood grew up around East Anglia, attending the independent Norwich School, before attending a local comprehensive.

Porter was made a deacon at St Peter's Day (29 June) 1977, by Bill Westwood, Bishop of Edmonton, at John Keble Church, Mill Hill, and ordained a priest the Petertide following (25 June 1978), by Gerald Ellison, Bishop of London, at St Paul's Cathedral. From 1977–1980, Porter served his first curacy at Edgware Parish Church in the Diocese of London, and from 1980–1983 was curate at St Mary's Haughton Green in the Diocese of Manchester. From 1983–1987, he was priest in charge of Christ Church, Bacup, Lancashire, and was made vicar of that congregation in 1987.
* Tim Westwood – English DJ and presenter of radio and television, son of Bill Westwood, former Bishop of Peterborough.
|align="center"| 1975 ||align="center"| 1984 || Bill Westwood || (1925-1999). First area bishop from 1979; translated to Peterborough

The Bishop of Brixworth is an episcopal title used by a suffragan bishop of the Church of England Diocese of Peterborough, in the Province of Canterbury, England. The title takes its name after the village of Brixworth in Northamptonshire and has shared responsibility (with the diocesan bishop) over the whole diocese.Diocese of Peterborough — Next Bishop of Brixworth announced  Following a proposal initiated by Bill Westwood, Bishop of Peterborough in 1985, and with the agreement of the General Synod of the Church of England in July 1987, the See was erected by Queen-in-Council on 26 July 1988.

Atwell was ordained in the Church of England: first, made a deacon at Petertide 1978 (25 June), by Gerald Ellison, Bishop of London, at St Paul's Cathedral, and then ordained a priest the following St Peter's Day (29 June 1979) by Bill Westwood, Bishop of Edmonton, at St James Muswell Hill. His career began with a curacy at John Keble Church, Mill Hill in the Diocese of London from 1978 to 1981.Famous London church From 1981 to 1987, he was chaplain of Trinity College, Cambridge and a lecturer in patristics.

Croft was ordained as deacon in the Diocese of London, on 25 September 1983 by Bill Westwood, Bishop of Edmonton, at St Andrew's Enfield (his title church). The following year, he was ordained as priest by Graham Leonard, Bishop of London, at St Paul's Cathedral on 23 September 1984. From 1983 to 1987 he was the curate of the parish church of St Andrew's Enfield. After that, he became vicar of Ovenden, an Urban Priority Area parish in the Diocese of Wakefield, from 1987 to 1996. In 1997, Croft was made a member of the Church of England Evangelical Council, which he was a part of until 2000.
*Bill Westwood (1925–1999), Anglican bishop in England, father of DJ Tim Westwood
*Tim Westwood (born 1957), British hip hop DJ, son of Bishop Bill Westwood
